list.expr: sum(vm_app_version{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance"}) by(short_version) unless (sum(vm_app_version{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance"} offset 20m) by(short_version))
list.name: version

description: Overview for VictoriaMetrics vmalert v1.83.0 or higher

panels.description: Shows if the last configuration update was successful. "Not Ok" means there was an unsuccessful attempt to update the configuration due to some error. Check the log for details.
panels.title: Config update

panels.description: Shows the total number of loaded alerting rules across selected instances and groups.
panels.title: Alerting rules

panels.description: Shows the total number of loaded recording rules across selected instances and groups.
panels.title: Recording rules

panels.description: Shows the total number of errors generated by recording/alerting rules for selected instances and groups.

targets.expr:
(sum(vmalert_alerting_rules_error{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", group=~"$group"}) or vector(0)) + 
(sum(vmalert_recording_rules_error{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", group=~"$group"}) or vector(0))

panels.title: Errors

panels.description:
Shows number of Recording Rules which produce no data.

 Usually it means that such rules are misconfigured, since they give no output during the evaluation.
Please check if rule's expression is correct and it is working as expected.
panels.title: No data errors

panels.description: Shows the number of fired alerts by job.
panels.title: Alerts fired total ($instance)

panels.description:
Top $topk groups by evaluation duration. Shows groups that take the most of time during the evaluation across all instances.

The panel uses MetricsQL functions and may not work with Prometheus.

targets.expr:
topk_max($topk, max(sum(
    rate(vmalert_iteration_duration_seconds_sum{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", group=~"$group"}[$__rate_interval])
/
    rate(vmalert_iteration_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", group=~"$group"}[$__rate_interval])
) by(job, instance, group)) 
by(job, group))

panels.title: Top $topk groups avg evaluation duration ($group)

panels.description: Shows how many requests (executions) per second vmalert sends to the configured datasource.
panels.title: Rules execution rate ($instance)

panels.description: Shows the error rate while executing configured rules. Non-zero value means there are some issues with existing rules. Check the logs to get more details.
panels.title: Rules execution errors ($instance)

targets.expr: sum(flag{is_set="true", job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance"}) by(job, instance, name, value)

panels.description:
Missed evaluation means that group evaluation time takes longer than the configured evaluation interval. 
This may result in missed alerting notifications or recording rules samples. Try increasing evaluation interval or concurrency for such groups. See https://docs.victoriametrics.com/vmalert.html#groups

If rule expressions are taking longer than expected, please see https://docs.victoriametrics.com/Troubleshooting.html#slow-queries."
panels.title: Missed evaluations ($instance)

panels.description:
The precentage of used RSS memory

If you think that usage is abnormal or unexpected, please file an issue and attach memory profile if possible.
panels.title: Memory usage % ($instance)

panels.description:
Amount of used RSS memory

If you think that usage is abnormal or unexpected, please file an issue and attach memory profile if possible.
panels.title: Memory usage ($instance)

panels.description:
Shows the CPU usage percentage per vmalert instance. 
If you think that usage is abnormal or unexpected pls file an issue and attach CPU profile if possible.
panels.title: CPU usage %($instance)

panels.description: Shows the max number of CPU cores used  by a `job` and the corresponding limit.
panels.title: CPU usage ($instance)

panels.description:
Panel shows the percentage of open file descriptors in the OS.
Reaching the limit of open files can cause various issues and must be prevented.

See how to change limits here https://medium.com/@muhammadtriwibowo/set-permanently-ulimit-n-open-files-in-ubuntu-4d61064429a
panels.title: Open FDs usage % ($instance)

panels.description:
Shows top $topk current active (firing) alerting rules.

The panel uses MetricsQL functions and may not work with Prometheus.

targets.expr: topk_max($topk, sum(vmalert_alerts_firing{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", group=~"$group"}) by(job, group, alertname) > 0)

panels.title: Top $topk active alerts ($group)

panels.description: Shows the events when rule execution resulted into an error. Check the logs for more details.
panels.title: Errors ($group)

panels.description:
Shows the current pending alerting rules per group.
By pending means the rule which remains active less than configured `for` parameter.

targets.expr: sum(vmalert_alerts_pending{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", group=~"$group"}) by(job, group, alertname) > 0

panels.title: Pending ($group)

panels.description: Shows the error rate for the attempts to send alerts to Alertmanager. If not zero it means there issues on attempt to send notification to Alertmanager and some alerts may be not delivered properly. Check the logs for more details.
panels.title: Errors rate to Alertmanager

panels.description: Shows how many alerts are sent to Alertmanager per second. Only active alerts are sent.
panels.title: Requests rate to Alertmanager by job ($group)

panels.description:
Shows the top $topk recording rules which generate the most of samples. Each generated sample is basically a time series which then ingested into configured remote storage. Rules with high numbers may cause the most pressure on the remote database and become a source of too high cardinality.

The panel uses MetricsQL functions and may not work with Prometheus.
panels.title: Top $topk rules by produced samples ($group)

panels.description:
Shows the rules which do not produce any samples during the evaluation. Usually it means that such rules are misconfigured, since they give no output during the evaluation.
Please check if rule's expression is correct and it is working as expected.
panels.title: Rules with 0 produced samples ($group)

panels.description: Shows the number of datapoints dropped by vmalert while sending to the configured remote write URL. vmalert performs up to 5 retries before dropping the data. Check vmalert's error logs for the specific error message.
panels.title: Datapoints drop rate ($instance)

title: VictoriaMetrics - vmalert
